0.user_question: Mandy owes Benedict $100. They agreed to have monthly interest of 2%. If Mandy was able to pay it after 3 months, how much should she give to Benedict?

ost_step.1: Interest rate per month = 2% or 0.02 when expressed as a decimal.
ost_step.2: For each month, Mandy would owe Benedict additional money due to interest on top of what she already owed him before that period ends (compound interest). This can be calculated using compound interest formula which is P(1+r)^n where r represents the time here i.e., number of periods for one unit increase/decrease; n stands for no.of such increases/decreases; finally 'P', pronounced pi, refers to principal amount initially invested/(borrowed)amount at start. In our case this means : Principal Amount Initially Owed =$100 , Rate Of Monthly Interests= .02 ; Time Period Becomes Three Months Hence Total Due=(1+$0.02)^3 * $100 Calculation goes like so :- Step By Step Breakdown:- Year Ending January:$100*(1+.02)=~$102.-Year Ending February:$102*(1+.02)=~$104.04.-And last but not least March,$104.04*(1+.02) ~=$106.12.(Note all values rounded
ost_step.3: To find out exactly how much needs to be paid back let’s round up every penny because you can't make partial cents payment..so its approximately around $106-$107 depending upon bank policy towards fractions of dollars.) Therefore considering everything together we reach Conclusion And Answer Is As Follows!::*Answer is Approximately Around  107 Dollars.*
